name: Lycanthropy
description: You are afflicted with lycanthropy and suffer the benefits and weaknesses.

options.name: Lycanthrope
options.description: You have the curse of lycanthropy and transform into a lycanthrope under a specific celestial condition, such as a full moon, only reverting back to your humanoid form the next day. You also automatically transform when you reach 5 health or lower, even if your health is 0. Every time you transform into a lycanthrope, you must make a resilience check of 10 or you start with the maddened condition. Falling to 0 health as a lycanthrope causes you to revert back to your humanoid form at 5 health, but unconscious until you complete a full rest. You must roll a 1d4 to determine how many days must pass before you can benefit from the health-based transformation again each time you revert back to your humanoid form.

options.name: Lycanthrope Weakness
options.description: All lycanthropes have a specific weakness:

subchoices.name: Weakness to Fire
subchoices.description: Your weakness is to fire, while in your lycanthrope form, you become afraid when you have the ignited condition. When in your humanoid form, you have a -2 penalty to heat mitigation.

subchoices.name: Weakness to Silver
subchoices.description: Your weakness is to silver, while in your lycanthrope form, physical damage you take from silver weapons or ammunition becomes true damage. When in your humanoid form, you take 1 true damage every minute that you are in contact with silver or an object that contains it. This damage can not bring you below 5 health, but does prevent you from transforming into your lycanthrope form.

subchoices.name: Weakness to Water
subchoices.description: Your weakness is to silver, while in your lycanthrope, you cannot willfully cross bodies of water and you become afraid when submerged in water. While in your humanoid form, you have a -2 penalty to cold mitigation.

options.name: Lycanthrope Type
options.description: There are various types of lycanthropes, all using a different statblock for their transformations:

subchoices.name: Werewolf
subchoices.description: You use the Werewolf statblock for your transformations and gain +1 skill with senses in your humanoid form.

subchoices.name: Werebear
subchoices.description: You use the Wearbear statblock for your transformations and gain +1 skill with might in your humanoid form.

subchoices.name: Wererat
subchoices.description: You use the Wererat statblock for your transformations and gain +1 skill with stealth in your humanoid form.
